content: I do not have personal opinions or beliefs. however, the use of oranges in "the godfather" has been analyzed by many film critics and scholars as a symbol of impending danger and death. oranges are often present in scenes leading up to violent events or character deaths, such as in the scene with don corleone getting shot at the fruit market or the scene with don corleone's assassination attempt in the garden. the use of oranges in these scenes creates a sense of foreshadowing and inevitability that adds to the tension and emotional impact of the film. however, it is important to note that director francis ford coppola and cinematographer gordon willis have not confirmed or denied this interpretation of the use of oranges in the film.
